_header: The fiend our foe ne may us dere
Subjects: Satan; devil; sermons, verse in; translations
_description: Verses urging us to resist the devil and he will flee from you (4 lines), a tag in the Fasciculus morum, translating Hostis non ledit…, the verse equivalent of the preceding prose illustration — two couplets

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
The fende oure foo may not vs dereBot we boghen to hym for
                    fereHe ys a lyoun but þu with stondeNot worth a flye yf þu
                    ne wonde
BodLauMis213.Editions:
Gray,  Douglas,
                        ed.  
             A Selection of Religious Lyrics.
Clarendon Medieval and Tudor Series.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1975: no.77b.

BodLauMis111.Transcription:
The fende oure fo ne may vs derebot ȝif we bowen to hym for
                    ferehe is a lyon bot þu wiht stondeAnd ferde as flyȝe yf
                    þou ne wounde

Bod410.Transcription:
The feend our foo may not vs dereBut if we bowe to hym for
                    fereHe is a lyoun but þu withstondeNowght worth a flye if þu
                    ne wonde

BodRawC670.Transcription:
Þe fende oure foe ne may vs dereBut ȝyffe we bowen hym for
                    fereHe is a lyon bote þou withstondAnd ferde as a flye ȝyf
                    þou ne wonde
BodRawC670.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 136.

OxfLinLat52.Transcription:
Þe feend oure foo ne may vs derebot if we bowen to hym for
                    fereHe is a lion but þou withstondeand ferd as fly yf þou ne
                    wonde

CamGon364.Transcription:
Þe fend oure foo ne may us derebut if we bowen to hym for
                    ferehe is a leon but þou wytstondeand ferd as flye if þou ne
                    wonde

CamStJohn159.Transcription:
þe fend owr foo ne may vs deyreBot yf we bow to hym for
                    ferehe ys a lyo [sic] bot yf þu wytstantand ferd as fle yf
                    þu ne wonde

DULCosViv2.Transcription:
The fend owr fo may vs naght dereBott ȝif we bowen hym for
                    ferehe is a lyon bot ȝow wyth stondeAnd ferd as flee ȝif
                    þu with stonde

EDU82.Transcription:
The fende oure foo ne may vs derebut yf we bowen to hym for
                    ferehe is a lyon but þu wythstondAnd ferd as a flyȝe yf
                    þu ne wond

Lincoln44.Transcription:
þe fend oure foo ne may vs dereBot ȝif we bow hem for
                    ferehe is a lyoon bot ȝe withestondeAnd ferd als flye ȝif
                    ȝe ne wonde

Spalding.Transcription:
The fende oure foe ne may vs derebot if we bowe to hym for
                    ferehe is a lyone bot if we wythstondeAnd ferd als a fly &
                        cetera
